wikitext.*:
<noinclude>{{month|January}}
Events that occurred on 1 January.
==On Earth==
</noinclude>
* '''[[1910]]''' - The earliest preserved [[J.R.R. Tolkien's diaries|diary entry]] is written by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]].
* '''[[1919]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] starts a new [[J.R.R. Tolkien's diaries|diary]], mainly written in the [[Sarati|Alphabet of Rúmil]].
* '''[[1926]]''' – [[E.V. Gordon]] replaces [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] in the Chair of English Language at the [[University of Leeds]]. 
* '''[[1938]]''' – In a series of lectures aimed at children, [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] lectures on ''[[Dragons (lecture)|Dragons]]'' in the [[University of Oxford|University]] Museum.
* '''[[1941]]''' – J.R.R. Tolkien resigns as Governor of [[King Edward's School]].
* '''[[1956]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Mr Polet|a letter to a fan]].
* '''[[1970]]''' - J.R.R. Tolkien writes [[Letter 315]].
* '''[[1972]]''' - Voice actress [[Jennifer Hale]] is born.
* '''[[1986]]''' – [[Inklings|Inkling]] [[Lord David Cecil]] dies.
* '''[[1995]]''' - ''[[Proceedings of the J.R.R. Tolkien Centenary Conference]]'' is published.
* '''[[2000]]''' - Actor [[Leon Wadham]] is born.
* '''[[2002]]''' - ''[[A Tolkien Miscellany]]'' is published.
* '''[[2003]]''' - The original [[Tolkien Gateway]] opens.
* '''[[2006]]''' - [[Tolkien News]] is created.
* '''[[2008]]''' - Fantasy novel ''[[The Search for the Red Dragon]]'' is published.
* '''[[2024]]''' - All of [[Index:Writings by J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien writings]] that were published during his lifetime entered into the public domain in countries where copyright expires 50 years after the author's death, such as in New Zealand and Belarus. In most other countries such as the United States, Canada, within the European Union, and Japan the works will remain under copyright until 2044.
